result.execSummary:
The defendant Mary Alice Glover was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments due to defendant being indigent.
*Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing on August 15, 2016 and to continue on the 15th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See CCAP financial payment plan application for specific monthly due dates for this UTPPP.
Amending charge to Receiving Stoplen Property, pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.34(1)(a), a Class A Misdemeanor.

Defendant Mary Alice Glover in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant provided proof that she attended her uncle's funeral on the last court date.  Court reiterates the Court's ruling on the last hearing.  Matter passed to discuss possible resolution.  Parties have reached a settlement.  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered charge be amended to Receiving Stolen Property, pursuant to Wisc. Stats. Sec. 943.34, a Class A Misdemeanor.   Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the amended information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve 6 DAYS in the House of Corrections,  with credit for 6 days time served.  

-Court WAIVES Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments due to defendant being indigent
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing on August 15, 2016 and to continue on the 15th day of each month thereafter until paid in full; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit Sheet

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense informs the Court that the defendant is unable to appear this date due her uncle passing away today. Defendant to provide proof of her uncle's death on the next Court date.  Court issues a bench warrant but stays the issuance of the bench warrant until the next Court date.  Daubert hearing proceeded.  Arguments heard.  Court's ruling on the testimony and report of Dr. Woody placed on the record.  Matter set for Hearing to allow for the Court to inform the defendant of the Court's ruling today.  Hearing scheduled for July 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Alice Glover in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Thomas L. Potter for Patrick Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm
Case set for Status Conference. Defense request a Dauber hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 14, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude in court.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Jude made contact with defendant.  Defendant thought this matter was set for June 30th.  She is currently at the hospital with her brother who was involved in a serious car accident.  Court ordered a bench warrant, but STAYED issuance of bench warrant until next Court date.  Defendant to provide proof that she was at the hospital with her brother  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mary Alice Glover in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties informed the Court that Daubert/Hazelton hearing needs to be conducted.  Defense to file brief on/before April 30, 2016 by 5:00 p.m.,   State to file a response brief by May 20, 2016 by 5:00 p.m.  Hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mary Alice Glover in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties unable to conduct motion today.  State requests time to file response to defendant's recent filed motion.  State's response is due on/before April 5, 2016.   Defense to contact Dr. Woody to obtain his schedule in which this matter can be scheduled for a Hearing.  Matter set for a scheduling conference.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Admit Testimony of Expert received and filed.
Report from Dr. Michael Woody dated March 6, 2016 received and filed.
Defendant's Witness List received and filed.

Defendant Mary Alice Glover in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense still waiting for medical records.  Defense wants to obtain an expert.  Matter calendared for a Dalbert Hearing/Decision.  State may file a Haseltine Motion depending on what the report says.  Defense has until February 19, 2016 to file their motion setting forth who they have retained and what they expect to prove.  State has until March 4, 2016 by 5:00 p.m. to file a response.  Each party in their respective motions must address their position.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:30 am.
